protocol_name: Embedding yeast colonies for light and electron microscopy
protocol_name_html: Embedding yeast colonies for light and electron microscopy
description:
The following is a modification of a Scherz R., 2001 method for colony embedding. The protocol described here is from:

Sarah Piccirillo, et. al. The Rim101p/PacC Pathway and Alkaline pH Regulate Pattern Formation in Yeast Colonies (2010)
Genetics 184:707-716; doi:10.1534/genetics.109.113480

Please see the full manuscript for additional details.
authors: Sarah Piccirillo, Melissa G. White, Jeffrey C. Murphy, Douglas J. Law,and Saul M. Honigberg
guidelines:
To embed colonies for sectioning, we modified a previously described method (Scherz et al. 2001), with a major change being the substitution of Spurr's reagent as embedding medium.

Original method:
SCHERZ, R., V. SHINDER and D. ENGELBERG, 2001 Anatomical analysis of Saccharomyces cerevisiae stalk-like structures reveals spatial organization and cell specialization. J. Bacteriol. 183: 5402–5413.

components.data: Incubate approximately 300 colonies on agar medium for the indicated time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate approximately 300 colonies on agar medium for the indicated time.

components.data: Remove an isolated colony (1-2 mm in diameter) and a small amount of the underlying agar medium, and place on a microscope slide
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove an isolated colony (1-2 mm in diameter) and a small amount of the underlying agar medium, and place on a microscope slide

components.data: Place several drops of 2% agar (42°C)  on a microscope slide, and immediately place the colony on the agar and then place several drops of agar on top of the colony and allow to solidify.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place several drops of 2% agar (42°C)  on a microscope slide, and immediately place the colony on the agar and then place several drops of agar on top of the colony and allow to solidify.

components.data: Trim the resulting agar block with a razor blade, and place in a 3.5 ml borosilicate screw-cap vial (Fisher 03-339-21B) containing 1.5ml 2%paraformaldehyde/2%glutaraldehyde.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Trim the resulting agar block with a razor blade, and place in a 3.5 ml borosilicate screw-cap vial (Fisher 03-339-21B) containing 1.5ml 2%paraformaldehyde/2%glutaraldehyde.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of Embedding yeast colonies for light and electron microscopy
source_data.protocol_name: Embedding yeast colonies for light and electron microscopy
source_data.protocol_name_html: Embedding yeast colonies for light and electron microscopy
source_data.annotation: All subsequent incubations and washes use 1.5 -2.0 ml and are performed in the same vial.
source_data.thread_text: All subsequent incubations and washes use 1.5 -2.0 ml and are performed in the same vial.
source_data.body: All subsequent incubations and washes use 1.5 -2.0 ml and are performed in the same vial.

components.data: Fix colonies by incubating for 7 days at 4°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fix colonies by incubating for 7 days at 4°C

components.data: Wash #1: Wash agar blocks on ice by incubating for 15 minutes with 1.5 ml of 0.15M sodium cacodylate (pH 7.2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #1: Wash agar blocks on ice by incubating for 15 minutes with 1.5 ml of 0.15M sodium cacodylate (pH 7.2)

components.data: Wash #2: Wash agar blocks on ice by incubating for 15 minutes with 1.5 ml of 0.15M sodium cacodylate (pH 7.2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #2: Wash agar blocks on ice by incubating for 15 minutes with 1.5 ml of 0.15M sodium cacodylate (pH 7.2)

components.data: Wash #3: Wash agar blocks on ice by incubating for 5 minutes with 1.5ml OS buffer (100 mM KH<sub>2</sub>PO<sub>4</sub>, 10 mM MgCl<sub>2</sub>, pH 6.0).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #3: Wash agar blocks on ice by incubating for 5 minutes with 1.5ml OS buffer (100 mM KH<sub>2</sub>PO<sub>4</sub>, 10 mM MgCl<sub>2</sub>, pH 6.0).

components.data: Wash #4: Wash agar blocks on ice by incubating for 5 minutes with 1.5ml OS buffer (100 mM KH<sub>2</sub>PO<sub>4</sub>, 10 mM MgCl<sub>2</sub>, pH 6.0).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #4: Wash agar blocks on ice by incubating for 5 minutes with 1.5ml OS buffer (100 mM KH<sub>2</sub>PO<sub>4</sub>, 10 mM MgCl<sub>2</sub>, pH 6.0).

components.data: If sections will be used for electron microscopy, add 1% OsO<sub>4</sub> in OS to vials to cover the agar blocks and incubate on ice in a chemical fume hood for 1 hr. Otherwise skip to step 13.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If sections will be used for electron microscopy, add 1% OsO<sub>4</sub> in OS to vials to cover the agar blocks and incubate on ice in a chemical fume hood for 1 hr. Otherwise skip to step 13.

components.data:
Dispose of 1% OsO4 in hazardous waste.
WashA: Wash with 1.5ml OS buffer by incubating on ice for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Dispose of 1% OsO4 in hazardous waste.
WashA: Wash with 1.5ml OS buffer by incubating on ice for 10 minutes.

components.data: WashB: Wash with 1.5ml OS buffer by incubating on ice for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: WashB: Wash with 1.5ml OS buffer by incubating on ice for 10 minutes.

components.data: Add 1.5 ml OS and incubate overnight at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1.5 ml OS and incubate overnight at 4°C.

components.data: WashA: Wash blocks with 1.5ml cold water by incubating on ice for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: WashA: Wash blocks with 1.5ml cold water by incubating on ice for 10 minutes.

components.data: WashB: Wash blocks with 1.5ml cold water by incubating on ice for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: WashB: Wash blocks with 1.5ml cold water by incubating on ice for 10 minutes.

components.data: Wash #1:  Add 1.5ml cold 25% ethanol and incubate on ice for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #1:  Add 1.5ml cold 25% ethanol and incubate on ice for 10 minutes.

components.data: Remove ethanol and resuspend in 1.5ml cold 100% ethanol. Leave the blocks overnight at 4°C in 100% ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove ethanol and resuspend in 1.5ml cold 100% ethanol. Leave the blocks overnight at 4°C in 100% ethanol.

components.data: Make Spurr's reagent by stirring slowly under chemical fume hood 5 grams ERL4221, 4 grams DER736 and 13 grams NSA for 20 minutes(Electron Microscopy Sciences).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make Spurr's reagent by stirring slowly under chemical fume hood 5 grams ERL4221, 4 grams DER736 and 13 grams NSA for 20 minutes(Electron Microscopy Sciences).

components.data: Spurr’s treatment
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 0.15 grams DMAE(Electron Microscopy Sciences) and stir for 20 minutes. De-gas for 1-2 hrs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.15 grams DMAE(Electron Microscopy Sciences) and stir for 20 minutes. De-gas for 1-2 hrs.

components.data: Spurr’s treatment
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash blocks with 1.5ml  unopened room temp 100% ethanol by incubating at room temp for 10 minutes. Repeat 4 more times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash blocks with 1.5ml  unopened room temp 100% ethanol by incubating at room temp for 10 minutes. Repeat 4 more times.

components.data: Spurr’s treatment
components.name: Section

components.name: Description

source_data.description: Treatment#1: Remove ethanol and add 1.5ml of a 2:1 ratio of 100% ethanol:Spurr's reagent.

components.data: Remove 100% ethanol:Spurr's reagent and add 1.5ml  Spurr's reagent to vial. Incubate for 4hrs at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove 100% ethanol:Spurr's reagent and add 1.5ml  Spurr's reagent to vial. Incubate for 4hrs at room temperature.

components.data: Replace with 1.5ml Spurr's reagent and rotate the vial overnight on the wheel at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Replace with 1.5ml Spurr's reagent and rotate the vial overnight on the wheel at room temperature.

components.data: Replace with 1.5ml Spurr's reagent and rotate the vial until late afternoon on the wheel at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Replace with 1.5ml Spurr's reagent and rotate the vial until late afternoon on the wheel at room temperature.

components.data: Remove the Spurr's reagent and replace with 1.5ml freshly made Spurr's reagent. Rotate the vial overnight on the wheel at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the Spurr's reagent and replace with 1.5ml freshly made Spurr's reagent. Rotate the vial overnight on the wheel at room temperature.

components.data: The next day replace with 1.5ml Spurr's reagent and rotate until the following day on the wheel at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The next day replace with 1.5ml Spurr's reagent and rotate until the following day on the wheel at room temperature.

components.data: The next day replace with 1.5ml Spurr's reagent and rotate until the following day on the wheel at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The next day replace with 1.5ml Spurr's reagent and rotate until the following day on the wheel at room temperature.

components.data: Place each agar block in a mold with 0.2ml Spurr's reagent and incubate at 60°C for four hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place each agar block in a mold with 0.2ml Spurr's reagent and incubate at 60°C for four hours.

components.data: Top off the molds with Spurr's reagent and incubate at 60°C for 3 days.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Top off the molds with Spurr's reagent and incubate at 60°C for 3 days.

components.data: Collect sections(0.5u) from the central region of the colony in a drop of dH20 on a glass slide. Dry slide on a 52°C heat block.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect sections(0.5u) from the central region of the colony in a drop of dH20 on a glass slide. Dry slide on a 52°C heat block.

components.data: Stain sections with 1% toluidine blue,1%Sodium Borate for 5-15 seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stain sections with 1% toluidine blue,1%Sodium Borate for 5-15 seconds.

components.data: Wash slide under a stream of dH20. Dry on heat block. Cover in Permount(Fisher SP15-100). Examine by light microscopy.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash slide under a stream of dH20. Dry on heat block. Cover in Permount(Fisher SP15-100). Examine by light microscopy.
